Articles.Content:
Can not delete Maneuver Node (Control Locked)

It's been a while since I've done any space travel and decided to try some old craft builds because I found the new version 1.31. is running many older craft from other versions.

While testing an old craft I came across this message when trying to delete a  Maneuver Node. Can someone tell me what button I may have pressed to Control Lock this Node or how to Unlock this Maneuver Node?

Here is what it looks like on the screen

 

Edited November 20, 2017 by Castille7
Question Answered

It's because you don't have a Commnet connection with the KSC. Your resource window isn't open, so I can't say if it's because you don't have power or just because your antenna is unable to reach Kerbin. If this is an old game, disable Commnet in the Settings menu. Otherwise, you're gonna need to set up some relay antennas.

1 minute ago, Cpt Kerbalkrunch said:

It's because you don't have a Commnet connection with the KSC. Your resource window isn't open, so I can't say if it's because you don't have power or just because your antenna is unable to reach Kerbin. If this is an old game, disable Commnet in the Settings menu. Otherwise, you're gonna need to set up some relay antennas.

I just noticed this at the same time you posted, thank you for the help this is exactly what was happening. I extended the antennas and now back on the mission.
Small nitpick: is because you didn't had a link with KSC neither a pilot onboard.

34 minutes ago, Spricigo said:

Small nitpick: is because you didn't had a link with KSC neither a pilot onboard.

 

I've made a really good habit not to forget the Kerbals, it's in my auto signature not to forget the Kerbals because I've forgotten so many times in the pass........so I did have a pilot onboard this time.

3 hours ago, Castille7 said:

I've made a really good habit not to forget the Kerbals, it's in my auto signature not to forget the Kerbals because I've forgotten so many times in the pass........so I did have a pilot onboard this time. 

A pilot? (not engineer, not scientist)

12 hours ago, Spricigo said:

A pilot? (not engineer, not scientist)

Now that!.. I didn’t think about, must be a pilot I have aboard because I am communicating now with KSC. Thank you for the information, this will help for future space travel.
